sentences.english: He was described by an obituary writer as "the man who taught America how to look at photographs."
sentences.chinese: 一位訃聞作家描述他是“教美國欣賞照片的人”。

sentences.english: The gallery has also invited students to compose an obituary for the socialite, based on the artwork. (AFP)
sentences.chinese: 藝廊也邀請學生爲芭黎絲的這座雕像撰寫訃聞。

sentences.english: This article argues that those death notices have been premature.
sentences.chinese: 本文主張那些訃聞發得太倉促了。

definition: lit. to govern from behind the curtain/to rule in place of the emperor (idiom)
Chiang Wei-kuo (1916-1997), adopted son of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
to adopt/to give for adoption (usually to a childless relative)
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to transfer (from production to other duties)/to take leave (for study or other job)/to dispose of property/to transfer assets (to avoid liability)
to follow blindly (idiom)/to take as one's only guide
David Clive Wilson, Baron Wilson of Tillyorn (1935-), British diplomat and China expert, Governor of Hong Kong 1986-1992
